38777625.review: edit: good game after find out about immersive mode
38777625.developer_response:
The game include 2 totally different game modes: Arcade mode where you don't have missions. And Immersive mode where you have missions. 
In any case: You can play the immersive mode without paying attention to the missions. I find them very funny, but they're totally optional. If you don't like it, please: ignore them and just get fun with the rest of the game.

38764080.review: I love this game!  This is exactly what VR should be.  Fun stuff that you cannot possibly do in real life in any way shape or form.  If you played the light gun games of the arcades of the 80s/90s you will like this.  And you might light it even if you didn't!!!

38710311.review: This is a great game especially if you liked the 80s arcade version.  I love how creative they were with the VR and the different elements.  One of our early favorites.

38594704.review: Really good game with a sweat zoom in mechanic that makes this a must VR title.

38594382.review: Operation Wolf is probably one of my all time favourite arcade games so this is a real treat ,,,,,,,,love it.

38552110.review: This is a great game.  You should buy this.

38429401.review:
Great fun. Brings back nostalgic memories for Operation Wolf. The way it transports you from a 2D arcade cabinet to full VR, like you've been sucked into the game, is a neat effect.

Some of the VR sequences are motion sickness inducing as there is forced camera movement due to being placed in a vechicle. I guess people will have differing reactions but I can't cope with any forced movement other than very slow and definitely not tilting. It would be better if there was an alternative available such as e.g. doing these sections in 2D or skipping them. The VR sequences where you're on the ground, standing still shooting things are great though and I wish they lasted longer.

38409367.review: Intuitive, fun, and challenging. Works great using a WMR headset.

38407281.review: Looks like it will be fun after some bugs are fixed. I get stuck at jump off points. Kill all the bad guys in the rescue map and then the game just keeps me there. Dont understand why it dont tell me ive failed and then end or take me on to another  new site to continue the mission. Im using the Rift. Paid 20$ now i have to wait for a fix. I will give a thumbs up because it will be a great game. But you may want to wait if you are useing the Rift

38404581.review: Bought it as weekend deal for half price but after playing it I wouldnt have thought twice about buying it full price. Very cool VR game with old school side scrolling arcade shooter AND first person shooter elements. If You have a VR set and you like shooters, this is for you. If you have a VR set and want something to showcase, I'd say grab it as well.

38384684.review: Ok This was far more than I expected! I had a complete blast so far. The immersion sequences make it a lot of fun. And the 3D effects looking through the "screen" is completely entertaining. I dont reccomend much, but this one is at the top of my list!

38332547.review: One of the best game for VR

38265647.review: Not the best looking game or scripted but FUN. Full price is bit overpriced but -50% is fair deal. Good for beginners

38259923.review:
VRゲーム内VR。

ゲームシステム自体はぶっちゃけオーソドックスなものですが、その手があったか！、と思わせる。
VR内ゲーム内で始まり、特定のターゲットを撃つとさらにゲーム画面の中に入り込む。新鮮な体験。

38122331.review:
如果你对这个游戏感兴趣，买之前不妨先看看我的视频了解一下
http://v.youku.com/v_show/id_XMzIxMTg5ODQyMA==.html

光看图片，我想你是绝对看不上这款VR游戏的，画面粗糙，场景简陋。
但是如果你真正进入这个游戏，你才会觉得，咦？这款游戏还可以？
没错，他的噱头并不是画面，而是丰富的游戏性

怎么说？

首先，从手上的武器开始说起吧，常规时候你只有一把伍兹和手雷
但是到了场景里，从狙击，霰弹枪，弓箭再到匕首应有尽有
丰富的战场武器让你应对各个场景游刃有余
武器的丰富度自然包括那颗不起眼的手雷
引力雷，寒冰雷，熔岩雷这种只有科幻里才会有的家伙居然也能在这里玩到
刚才说到“场景里”，这个词汇你一定很奇怪，难道我平时不在这个场景里吗？
并不在。这就是这个游戏另外一个特点
普通射击的时候，我们是在街机的画面上玩耍，但是如果你想进入游戏里的场景
你可以激活地图上散落的圆形标志，这代表 你可以在此和敌人刚正面
地图的生成是跟随着你的街机镜头自动衍生的，所以我觉得这场景是一个很好的转场效果
可以迅速的到下一个繁衍战场，而不会显得很突兀，这点上来说是非常聪明的
因为这个场景可不只换武器那么一点内容而已

还有什么？

问的好，因为你还可以融入载具，让载具成为你的武器
场景里还有着各种载具让你操作，武装汽车，快艇，飞机，等等战略工具
你可以单手开着汽车，另一只手对沿路敌人疯狂扫射，如果你愿意，还可以双脱手
亦或是操纵战机，对沿线地区进行导弹轰炸，最后再来个帅气的跳伞
这些你都可以体验到

很多人会问这个流程怎么样？

目前来看，关卡是比较多的，关卡的解锁依赖你在各关卡中完成任务的能力
徽章得到的越多，关卡解锁的就越快，还包括自我武器和属性的的提升
都与徽章息息相关，玩的越久，你就越强大
如果你喜欢这类射击游戏
不妨买了玩玩
值得购买

38080442.review: epic feeling when first played , and lot of replayability ( scores , unlocks ) . one of the games i make people play on their first VR experience and they all loved it

37995540.review: Operation Initiated... enough said. :)   O.k, maybe not quite enough.  This awesome homage to the original arcade classics brings back the feeling of walking into your regular arcade, and seeing a machine gun stuck on top of an arcade cabinet. Yeah, WTF!  Reloaded.

37912074.review:
Not as great as all of the other reviews make out, the game is fun but is let down by poor visuals and controls.  Some of the immersion points are great fun but others are let down by the controls.

You will have fun playing this game but its not worth 14.99 imo

37854391.review: I saw this and thought of Operation Wolf. It is mostly like that, but the laser sight makes aiming MUCH easier. There's no story and the primary view makes the soldier look like the little green plastic soldiers, but there are immersion points that are amazing (the flight needs some work and the driving is a little wonky), especially the exploding arrows with the bow. It's a great sit down game for what it is. I would recommend it, just don't expect depth.

37186517.review: Very original! if you like Arcade and 80's, 3D, VR and shooting then buy this.

36696805.review: This really is like the game I dreamed of when I was a kid. For the price you get heaps of levels and the upgrade system is fairly well balanced. It could use a few tweaks here and there but overall its a lot of fun. If you liked Op Wolf or even if you played with toy soldiers and army men a lot as a kid you'll love it! 4.5/5

36686498.review:
I'm not often compelled to review anything but I simply have to for Operation WarcadeVR as it's brought me the most fun so far on the Vive.
It's become my new goto game to show to Vive first timers and there can be few better accolades than that alone, but there's so much more to it.

On the surface a simple classic and highly nostalgic shooter based on Op Wolf from the 80s, but the depth it offers with absolutely incredible 'immersion points' just goes vastly better.

The immersion points are little set pieces that break away from the normal side scrolling and break up the flow with excellent little minigame scenes. Along with these are oodles of challenges to complete which often occur wiithin the immersion points.

No other game has made me feel quite so epic. Dodging bullets and batting them away with a titanium uzi or a shield never felt so heroic. 

Incredible game, exceptional quality that surpasses most offerings on the Vive and a fantastic demo of the capabilities of the tech. I love it!

36685263.review: An insanely fun VR shooter. You basically go INSIDE an arcade cabinet. It's mad.

36632653.review: Excellent concept executed superbly and keeps getting better with every update. Great stuff.

36607582.review:
Operation Wolf for the VR generation and it's just amazing the way it transports you into the game it's just mind blowing.

100% recommended

36578868.review: Pour les rétrogamers et néorétroagmers, pour les fans de salles d'arcades ou pour les tireurs acharnés. Vraiment top ce petit jeu. De la progression, une âme sympathique, un second degrès bien sympa. Jeu bien poli, bien fini. Allez y

36379360.review:
Love this game!  I'm old enough to remember Operation Wolf and this brings it all back and then some!  Drives trucks, fly helicopters, parachute.  Not to mention the various immersive modes.  Awesome game.  It's been a while since I've properly enjoyed a VR title (Rick & Morty game was kinda cool).  I can see a little motion sickness for some people on the choppers etc but this is WAR! 

100% recommended!

36187106.review:
"Years ago, before the days of modern personal computers and way before the rise of Xbox and PlayStation, people used to get their gaming fix by visiting their local arcade. A pocket full of change and a few spare hours could bring endless joy.

Operation Warcade is a VR shooter that attempts to bring back that gaming nostalgia by transporting you into a classic 1980s virtual gaming arcade. It might seem like a simple premise - especially when you realise that you can only play two of the machines in the arcade - but its original take of two experiences of the same game in different styles, gives it enticing originality.

Is Operation Warcade's side-scrolling and first-person shooter combo concept as interesting as it sounds?

Operation Warcade VR is one of the most enjoyable and original VR games we've played. It's smart and witty, yet has that nostalgia value that always warms our hearts.

With the variety offered by the two gaming modes, along with the challenges, achievements, unlocks and a ranking system, there's plenty of opportunity to get hours and hours of gameplay out of this one. 

In our various play sessions, we were disappointed at having to stop due to standing up for too long or having other real-world issues getting in the way - you know, like having to go to sleep. Which is testament to how addictive Operation Warcade VR's gameplay is."


Read the rest of review here - http://www.pocket-lint.com/review/142252-operation-warcade-vr-review-reinventing-the-arcade-experience-for-virtual-reality

And see gameplay footage:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g8O6kaKViko

36154794.review: If you are on the fence about getting this game Grab it now why it's on sale. Even without a sale it's worth the money they probably have one of the most creative uses of vr so far. It takes me back to the days of nintendo playing pow in the late 80s it also has pretty decent  graphics. Extremely immersive how you go in 3D and back to 2D. Felt like I was really in an arcade playing a game when one of the characters was behind me watching me play this game.

36134235.review:
One of the best games yet. Easy but not too easy. 
Well worth buying whether young or old.
The different levels and the integration of the variety is excellent.
I can recommend this 100%

36119712.review: I'm very new to VR, but this game on my Oculus Touch is absolutely awesome. I know I should give it a rest and try some more of the great VR experiences but I cannot "put this down". I guess it helps to remember playing this sort of game in an arcade, but the way you're looking “into” the action through a massive screen and then actually becoming part of it a few times each level is genius. The guns feel super accurate (well, at least as accurate as I am) and it’s the first time I’ve felt like I’m actually using a sniper rifle when I look down the scope. I’m playing on a 970 GPU with a few generations old i5 and have no performance problems.

36031035.review: Great relaxing VR title. Definitely worth its money.

36002446.review:
One of my favorite shooter games in VR that actually has replayability due to the mission system and unlocks! It's also perfect for showing off your VR to new users.

You can drive jets, helicopters, and trucks; get into knive throwing battles, go slow-mo like the Matrix, and more! Never seen so many unique mechanics in one game and pulled off so intuitively.

35901678.review:
Да в общем то нормальная, годная стрелялка. Много разных миссий, приятная картинка, довольно оригинальная идея с игровым автоматом. Годно. Обзор и геймплей ниже:

35756164.review: This game is an absolute riot! For $15.00 dollars you can't go wrong with this gem of a game. This is like buying your own interactive arcade machine for your HMD. I think this would be on the top of my list of games to demo to a new player to VR.

35742397.review:
这游戏看起来好像一般，要不是出了demo我都不会买，自从玩了demo后，感觉意犹未尽，买了玩了后，我想说这真是一个有创意的好游戏，关卡也丰富，是一个被忽视的好游戏，玩了这么多射击VR游戏，难得还能玩到一款有新鲜感的，值得推荐。

这游戏的设定就是，你在VR中打游戏机，射中某些东西后，会以第一人称进入游戏世界，开车、快艇、开直升机、跳伞、飞刀、射箭、狙击枪、重力枪、各种特效的手榴弹，很多元素令你玩起来总会有新鲜感。能够毁坏的物体有很多，就算隔着屏幕玩游戏机视角的时候，都有很好的沉浸感，比如一颗导弹从屏幕里射出来，这样的沉浸感真是其他全程第一人称的VR游戏不能给的。

35726266.review:
I enjoyed the game quite a bit.  Reminded me of the old arcade game, but obviously much better presentation.

Nice break from the FPS shooters.

35656752.review:
Operation Warcade VR is an action / shooter game where the player is standing in front of an arcade machine: you can immerse yourself into the game by activating an icon.
The game-play is just brilliant! It feels like you?re playing the game from a window perspective; soldiers will run from the right and left.
All you have is an Uzi and a few grenades! As you progress within a mission, you?ll notice icons here and there.
Each of these icons can be activated by shooting at them.

The graphics are really good and the controls work great, also sound is really good.

So overall, the game is really great.

35628766.review:
One of the essentials for VR, especially if you're a fan of the Operation Wolf/Thunderbolt arcade experience. 

Beats the pants off the ZX Spectrum light phaser.

35604569.review:
My inner child just got resurrected...

If you ever used time in the arcade throwing coin after coin into games like Operation Wolf, then this game is a BIG yes!

The devs have been true to the original feel of those games AND they managed to add some mechanics that works perfect for VR.

BIG yes from me!

35397692.review: This game is just outstanding in so many ways. There's so much variety and constant action. For example the point of player's view is constantly changing between sidescrolling and first-person sequences. You find yourself facing the enemy with knives, rocket launchers, sniperguns, shotguns and more, you even fly jets (you even can eject) and helicopters, drive trucks, and so on... all in first person perspective. Everything is very polished, sound is great, too. It feels like 7 or 8 different games while all of them are very well done. The game recreates an old arcade-game I used to play in the 80s. Very good job, I reeeaaaally dig it.

35189255.review:
https://youtu.be/XMkzvUrQ-oU  (Game play without comments).

35123634.review: excelente arcade game, um dos meus preferidos, as ultimas atualizações otimizou bem o jogo, deixando-o bem mais agradável, curte os arcades de tiro, este obrigatório, um modelo a seguir.

35045753.review:
I'm not normally into shooter or FPS games, but this game is definitely an exception. I found it easy enough to complete, but could go back to try for goals I'm given for each setting.

The way you execute an arcade game in VR is fantastic. I really enjoyed being able to lean forward to look farther down the sides, and ducking down when I needed.

The "immersion mdoe" or whatever it is called is over the top. As I mentioned I'm not normally one for shooter, but these experiences were short enough that it was a great addition, and helped break up the gameplay so it didn't feel the same throughout.

I'll definitely be putting in more hours into this game, as well as sharing more videos with my followers so anyone with VR may decide to pick it up and give it a try!

35004019.review: I am blown away with how fun this game is. I have over 50 vr games of which most are just a novelty which you can put down after 10 minutes. Operation Warcade took every aspect of the old arcade game and improved on it with new and innovative ways to implement vr. Worth the 20 dollars.

34952982.review: I grew up loving arcade light gun games. This game instantly made me giddy and excited. Its view kicks back and forth from inside the arcade, to inside the arcade machine, to inside the actual battlefield all seamlessly. Instant fun, great arcade shooting aim for touch controlls. Really fantastic! One of my favorite VR Games.

34539291.review: Operation Wolf in VR.. its great.

34444851.review: Great execution for an arcade remake. Thank you.

34432232.review: 总体来说很不错，就是战机操作有点难

34364863.review: the game isn't that bad at most definitely has potential it wasn't exactly what I like but at the end of the day the game is what it is it it's a VR arcade game

34353553.review: The most imaginative VR game I've played so far.

34302528.review: For the time I played (didn’t play much), I really enjoyed it, although there is a lot of room for improvement in terms of graphics, animations, sounds, and physics in the game, this game have some really cool and special things I didn’t ever see yet in VR, the first one is the part when your character suddenly teleports inside the game as a driver, you are actually driving the car and shooting both at the same time and it feels so real and awesome, this is definitely the best driving experience I had in VR yet, short, but so awesome I had to write a review for this game specially for this. And surprisingly I had no motion sickness at all! And I’m really prone to motion sickness in general, which surprised me a lot, You drive and shoot; it’s so awesome, very well made. There are more parts when you are on a helicopter that are also very cool, This game can be even better if the dev’s take those parts and expand it somehow someway. Also I’ll be happy to see co-op mode, more levels, improvement in animations, graphics and the stuff I mentioned above etc… but all in all I recommend this game for what it is just to experience the driving+shooting parts, so well made.

34266506.review:
ゲーセンにあるBox型の筐体の中で遊ぶガンシューティングをVRにしちゃった感じ。
なのでゲーセンの中から始まる、そして目の前の筐体の銃を手に取ってゲーム開始となる。
基本的にプレイヤーはそれほど動く必要はないので立居のままで遊べます。

ゲーム内容は右へ自動で流れていくスクロールタイプのシューティングゲーム、あくまでも、ゲーセンの筐体で遊んでいるので周りを見渡せば筐体が見える。
しかし、プレイ途中にある一部のアイテムを銃で撃つことで一時的にゲームの中へ入ることが可能となる、このシステムに僕は好印象。
銃の種類はそれほど多くはないです、そもそも、その都度指定の武器を持ってる状態なので切り替えなんかはできません。

1プレイ10分程度なのでサクッと遊べます、各ステージに3つのノルマが用意されていて、それを達成することにより勲章が貰え、その数に応じてステージが解放されていくシステム。
1つクリアするたびにゲーセン内の自分の後ろにノリノリ？のギャラリーが増えていくサービスも付いてます。振り向いたら割と目の前に居てビビるのでドッキリに弱い人は注意です。

34232301.review:
https://youtu.be/hANyvjpxIls

Operation Warcade VR is a dynamic and fun FPS game, designed specifically for virtual reality. The gameplay involves jumping into a video game inside a virtual arcade, engaging in combat with enemy soldiers in a classic war arcade style game, using weapons such as guns or grenades, with the potential to unlock further environments by completing numerous missions and levels. There are two possible modes; classic mode in which you can pass 6 levels and the final boss, or a mode in which you can complete 108 missions, 36 levels and unlock upgrades. The game is incredibly immersive, and there are even some other unique features that you can experience, such as shooting the enemy from inside of a tank or helicopter, and playing from different perspectives during combat. Leader-boards are present, which is great as this adds a competitive aspect to the game. You can also play this game in 2D/3D on your PC if you wish to. The only thing I would have liked that is not present, is more realistic people in the arcade. Overall, it’s like having a classic arcade style war game at your disposal but without having to spend coins on retries, tons of fun and perfectly priced.

34210694.review:
Fucking Awesome one of the best VR games I have played so far, the immersion arcade option is just epic. This is what should be coming out for VR, thank you just when I was getting a little jaded with some of the VR titles I have played recently something this fun comes along.

Will be my show people VR game from now on as most can relate to the old arcade games but this new take will blow them away. Talk about making someone feel like Rambo, I can't highly recommend this game enough to anyone who has VR and has been a long time gamer.

34203280.review:
Overall 11/10
Edit 19th Aug 17: added a couple more points to list of why nots and another buggy glitch I found. Don't let that put you off though ;)

This game is by far the best VR experience I've had to date.  I'm old enough to remember the original Operation Wolf in the arcades. That machine got a lot of my 50p's I tell you.
So what can I say about this game? 

1. Whether you have VR or not, buy it. It plays in 2D/3D on a regular screen as well.
2. I got it in the steam sale for £8.99 but it's easily worth the full asking price.
3. You build up a posse of NPC fans behind you. Virtual pals are better than none I guess.
4. If you feel the rage after losing go for a walkabout and punch/push some of them over.  It's very theraputic.
5. In VR mode you can almost stick your head in the screen to look around.  
6. Immersion within immersion.  There are various immersion points in all the levels that give you a different POV in the game.  This is amazingly executed in VR. I luvs the explosive <3 bow & arrows <3
7. It surpasses the original arcade game in many many ways, suffice to say, the game is awesome.

One niggling issue is the game crashes out on rare occasions. 
Another bug is the game glitches sometimes in VR, making the view jumpy/shaky, which is a little off-putting to say the least. Thankfully it doesn't happen very often and when it does just restart the game. Not a huge problem as I said but will keep submitting bug reports.

Whether you're into playing classic arcade or want fresh, fun challenges, then this game deserves a bit your time. 

Quite simply, this is an excellent remake of an 80s all time classic. It comes with my "RaNDoM(PReCiSioN) Highly Recommended" badge.

34186465.review:
This is just a fun game, bought it not expecting much but really enjoy playing it it is not too complicated, it is really good being beamed into the game from outside the arcade machine. I have palyed simial games in arcades and this mimicks them really well with the added twist of being sucked into the game 1st person. 
Really funny to turn around and see all the babes cheering me on, bit odd though that they fall over the moment you touch them? Still funny though think the one in white has forgot her panties lol. 

A fun game - really enjoyed it for what it is - my growing audience is just a bonus.

34182664.review:
Lettin ya know from the start, played this on an Oculus Rift. It is what it looks like: you go into VR and then into an arcade. If you were a teen in the 90s, you probably sunk some quarters into this baby. Nostalgia aside, this was a lot of fun. There are two modes (2 stand up arcade machines in fact), one for a regular version of the game with optional 3d mode (just shoot at the toggle) and the fully VR immersive. The 3d was a strain on my eyes (felt like I was going cross eyed) so I stuck with the VR. 

You can play like normal except you can defy some laws of somethin' and stick your head in the game to scan (and shoot) the areas. It was more fun that it sounds. At regular intervals, an "immersive" mode pops up - you shoot it - and bam! You are inside the game and in some kind of fight for your life. These immersive experiences vary from throwing knives, double uzi's, to (poorly) flying a jet fighter. And that's all I got to before logging out and writing this. This game is a keeper for me. Love the idea wouldn't mind seeing more old classics come back to life.

34140430.review:
Like i promise, i re-évaluate my opinion, you have 100% positives reviews. ;)
Après ce petit message au programmeur du jeu je ré-édite donc mon avis sur celui-ci ! Je pense qu'un changement de CG et quelques mises à jour de Steam VR et du jeu auront eu raison des bugs rencontrés !
Bref, sinon concernant le jeu, celui-ci vous replonge presque directement dans les salles d'arcades d'antan (les plus vieux sauront de quoi je parle :))

Pour les points positifs :
+ L'ambiance des vieilles bornes et salles d'arcade !
+ Le jeu promet d'être assez long, surtout si l'on veut avoir les 108 étoiles.
+ Les points d'immersion dans les niveaux sont une excellentes idées.
+ Les succès ont l'air facilement obteignables.

Pour le négatif : 
- Je vais un peu chipoter mais je dirais que graphiquement ça aurait pu être un peu mieux.

Voila, comme dis, si vous rechercher un bon shoot sympa celui-ci est exactement ce qu'il vous faut !

34109967.review: Addictively fun, simple, and well implemented.

34109427.review:
Even though there are some technical
issues. This is must have.

Buy it, when it is on sale.

34102780.review:
Occasional crashes which cause a complete restart of the system but I am having fun playing this through. Got it in a sale so - value wise it was pretty good. Not sure about a full price game given the number of crashes I have had...

Graphics are good enough for what the game is, accuracy is decent and some nice weapons to play around with (I like the sniper rifle).

34091457.review:
tl;dr if you played Operation Wolf buy this, and even if not if it's on sale and in your price range you should give it a try.

This is a really fun game. It's hard to explain why it's good unless you played Operation Wolf, but if you did, it's that but the game sucks you inside for really exciting bits. You get 1/2 uzis for a rails shooting experience ala Time Crisis/etc based on a classic arcade shooter, but the game (If you choose) sucks you inside for parts of it and allows a 3d experience that makes it play a little different to the classic. 

Great, busy devs, a lot of updates and underplayed/underrated title. Worth a buy if you like arcade rail shooters even a little, and if you have any soft spot in your heart for Operation Wolf don't even think about it, bro.

(Low play time is due to playing at a friends, bought a copy right away.)

What I do know is that I'd highly recommend this game.

34065745.review:
Being of the generation that actually went to the arcades to play games, and remembering vividly the game this was based on, I was looking forward to seeing how this one translated in to VR.

I have not been disapointed, with what I've found to be a very engaging game, easy to pick up and a bit trickier to master, with great fun immersive sections, where you really go VR into the game, driving the APCs, flying the jets and fighting infantry style, on the ground - brilliant.

I love the fact you can just hang around in the video arcade between games, but it would be nice if the other arcade machines were operational as well, even if just simple 2d blasters, and more interaction with the other occupants of the arcade, but thats not really the core of the game, just window dressing so not something to knock points off for.

Great game, worth the money, especially at 30% off which it was when I bought it.

If you played this type of game 20 years ago in the arcades, this is IMO a no brainer purchase.

Now please do a version of Time Crisis that looks/plays/feels like the original to keep the good old days posse playing and buying!

Lo recomiendo.

33972260.review:
[h1]Operation Warcade - [i]Much much more than a chance to relive your childhood favorite arcade game![/i][/h1]
Back when i was still relatively young there was a game in the arcade that really called to me, it was called Operation Wolf and instead of using the standard controller you got to use an uzi that was attached to the cabinet(and if you got to the arcade as they were turning on the systems you got to play it for free for a life :) shhhhhhh don't tell the arcade owners), so when i was sent a review copy of Operation Warcade i was both excited and a little apprehensive. Revisiting childhood games of yesteryear can often reveal that you are remembering them through rose tinted glasses. 
First let me be clear on this, i can not say if the game copies the level layout of Operation Wolf, the old arcade game may of sucked many an hour away from my life, made me late for a date and ate a lot of my loose change back in those years but i can not tell you the level layout lol, but the feel of the game is there, the style of the sound effects etc are perfect. 

[b]ROOMSCALE / ENVIRONMENT / GRAPHICS[/b]
 When you load in you get two arcade cabinets in front of you and find yourself in a small arcade, the environment is fine for its purpose though i found some of the arcade denizens a little creepy. So why two arcade cabinets?
One is the immersive mode (more on that in a second).
The second one is the standard one, this plays much like the original arcade machine from way back then, though with a toggle to make the screen 3d (with an effect that would make any 3d tv hang itself from its power cord in shame, really it is that good of a 3d effect...but hey we are talking vr here and we all know that vr is better than 3d to a degree so high it is not worth talking about) 
So let us get to immersive, here is where this game really shines! As you load in you find yourself in a dark room with a large window, this overlooks the game, tiny enemies scurry about as you shoot them through the window, there are pickups there are special grenades, all in all if this was just what there was to the game i would be giving it a hearty recommendation, it is good, VERY good and a unique perspective to play in…..but it actually got even better, i shot a pickup and found myself moved into the game, i was driving an APC i was controlling the wheel with one hand and shooting with the other, this was amazing. Later on i got pulled into the flight seat of a fighter jet...which did not last very long as clearly the jet was defective and did not fly right (nothing to do with my piloting skills honest….ok ok it may of been my fault but it was hard to fly, but oh so very cool. There are more of these type of interactions and they make for a very cool feature in the game.


[b]PERFORMANCE[/b] 
I had no issues until i tried to up the video settings, this crashed my capture software and sent performance issues throughout, However that is more a streamer issue than one you will face every day (and the reason for the double video).

[b]INTUITIVENESS[/b] 
Certain things are not explained well or at all, i had no idea how to fly the plan or what i was expected to do in it for example or that i could teleport around the arcade, while this is not major it is something that the developer needs to improve.

[b]MULTIPLAYER:[/b] 
It has leaderboard support


[b]PROS:[/b] 
[list]
[*] Operation wolf.
[*] The immersive mode viewpoint is awesome to play in!
[*] The immersive mode “pulled into the game” moments are very cool.
[*] There appears to be a lot of levels that will take a while to complete.
[*] Although this is an old favorite and nostalgia can often cloud opinion of them it’s fresh perspective makes the game so much fun.
[*] As well as the immersive mode you also get the classic mode which is like having your own arcade cabinet at home.
[/list]

[b]CONS:[/b] 
[list]
[*] Some of the controls (ie plane) are not well explained)
[*] The arcade users are creepy….no really, i turned round to see a woman with her arms out like she was going to clap just shaking them while staring at me…..that is nightmare fuel man.
[/list]

[b]VIDEO[/b]
This is actually the first and second tries together as i crashed the capture software changing the video settings and did not realise for a while (this also meant the second try i was a little tired lol)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_MjDrD_qSW0


[b]VERDICT[/b] 

If you have ever wanted an arcade cabinet in your home or played Operation wolf, then get this game. If you like to reward developers that create something unique (that viewpoint changing is indeed unique) get the game. If you like vr then....you know what...get the game, you will not regret it.

33967655.review:
Operation Warcade VR is a Virtual Reality wave based shooter which provides plenty of nostalgia and a unique spin on a familiar VR genre. 

Fans of the classic Operation Wolf or similar arcade shooters from the 90s will instantly feel right at home. The game launches with you standing in front of two arcade machines;  One providing a ‘traditional’ arcade shooter experience, the other transporting you into a large imax style screen experience for you to enjoy the game. It’s a fun way to hide the ‘menu’ user experience within a virtual reality interface. 

Once you are in the game, nostalgia reigns supreme. The tried and true arcade shooter cliches are all here; dumb soldiers running from spawn, exploding barrels, incredibly fragile helicopters and lots of explosions. 

Experiencing this all in virtual reality however, provides an extremely unique and refreshing trip down memory lane. It also allows for the major selling point; the ability to be transported directly into the arcade machine  at key moments to experience the soldier's first person perspective. 

Wave based shooters are slowly becoming a tired VR genre, but this unique mix of ‘physical’ arcade machine mechanics and first person perspective provides a unique spin on the genre. The feeling of using an actual arcade machine allows you to overlook the cliches of the arcade shooter genre and simply have fun. 

With over 108 missions over 36 levels, this early access title packs plenty of value.

33940705.review: Well polished and high production value. Worth the asking price. A definite buy when on sale. Brings all the arcade nostalgia.

Devs are very friendly and active in the forums, fixing bugs etc.  Just a really fun and already very complete feeling title for an Early Access release.  Definitely recommended :)

33368905.review:
So how is it?
Unique! There is not a single VR game that i could compare it to.
There are 2 different modes to play the game.
The first as a arcade machine simulator. You are in front of an arcade machine, take your gun and shoot at the screen. Like the real ones were you have a real gun in you hands. The only difference is that you can teleport inside the game at some set spots and shoot or drive vehicles for a short amount of time. (really cool)

The 2nd (immersion mode) is what you will play porbably most of the time. Its is a bit like the first mode but instead of a small arcade cabinet screen you have a big movie theatre screen in front of you. And now it gets funny. As soon as the level starts the flat screen becomes 3d. This enables you to look into the screen to both sides beyond the boarders of the screen. This is a great idea and should be tried for other games as well. 

There will be 36 levels (ca. 5min per level) with 3 objektives each. Every cleared objektive gives you a star. With the stars you unlook levels and upgrades(more ammo, time....)

For older people who liked the arcades back than it´s highly recommended. Also if you look for unique games and well as for showoff games.( no explanation needed)

If 20 bucks is to much for you right now leave it on your wishlist and wait for a sale. This belongs in every good VR collection.

Quick update now that it left EA: Still awesome.

33090135.review: The game is like a shooter at your local arcade but 10 times better.  A lot of mindless fun.  It has objectives that you need complete to progress in the game.  Looking forward to playing the newer levels.  The developers are actively improving and adding to the game.  This is my sleeper hit for VR gaming.

32389954.review:
Operation Warcade VR:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
   
It has been a long time since I visited a game parlour. You know, those places where you have many arcade machines that work with coins. These types of establishments were easy to find in the 80’s and I used to spend endless hours playing in them. Operation Warcade VR was inspired by these classic 80’s arcade war games. Now you can experience at home and in virtual reality being in a game parlour and taking on an army with your Uzi and grenades in Operation Warcade VR.

Operation Warcade VR is an action / shooter game where the player is standing in front of an arcade machine; you can immerse yourself into the game by activating an icon.

Here you are in your own virtual game parlour and right in front of you you’ll see two arcade machines on display. They are the same games, by the way; one is the 3D classic game version and the other one is the immersive VR experience.

Before you start a mission, you’ll notice three specific tasks to do within this level.  If you successfully achieve all the tasks, you will be awarded three stars which will go towards unlocking new levels and upgrading your weapons.  Bear in mind that some tasks will take you more than one go to accomplish and there are one hundred and eight stars to collect! 
The game-play is just brilliant! It feels like you’re playing the game from a window perspective; soldiers will run from the right and left, coming out of buildings or out of the jungle (depending of the stage). Some will be shooting bullets, other will throw knives at you. Some of the bullets can be shielded off with your Uzi but knives and mortar shells need to be deflected with an accurate shot. To top it off, vehicles such as jeeps, helicopters and boats are appearing everywhere. All you have is an Uzi and a few grenades! As you progress within a mission, you’ll notice icons here and there. Each of these icons can be activated by shooting at them. One will have a slow motion effect; the ones I really like are those you activate and then jump into the front line, in a car, on a boat or in a helicopter with the massive machine gun at your disposal - just a lot of fun and something I have not experienced before in VR. 

The graphics are really good and the controls work pretty well, too. I personally did not experience any crashes whatsoever, but there were a few glitches. Bear in mind this game is still an early access at this stage. 

Positives:
~~~~~~~ 

-	Good graphics
-	Plenty of levels 
-	Play the game in classic or Innovative immersive mode
-	Great gameplay
-	Achievements and trading cards

Negatives:
~~~~~~~~ 

-	Couple of glitches here and there 

A really fun shooter with an innovative immersive mode of play! I can’t wait to see the full version.

7/10

Key provided by developer/publisher for review purposes. Any opinions expressed are entirely my own!

This game was really surprising…perhaps as I wasn’t expecting much, however it really delivered on a very well-polished old time arcade experience with a few new major twists.

In my opinion it totally captures the feel of the old arcade game and goes further to demonstrate how old arcade style games can be perfectly adapted to VR, a promising new area indeed (albeit for some nostalgia).

The game itself is very challenging on the higher levels…You jump from a holding an uzi at the virtual arcade machine screen in a third person like view (the arcade screen is up close), this forms the core game play as you would have experienced in the old arcade version), the twist it takes is it puts you into the game itself by optionally shooting various power-up like crates. 

The crates launch you instantly into a multitude of modes with everything from being on the field in first person (3d) with the uzi or into vehicles including trucks, tanks, dual wielding shotguns out of a helicopter window :), to even flying a fighter jet using the vive wands…these “launches” don’t last very long but serve to break up the game play superbly and is really well executed.

Again this game will really surprise you, at full price it’s still a worthy purchase, but on sale it’s a no-brainer.

Enjoyment factor: 7.5/10
Length/Value for Money: 8/10 (I picked this up at 50% off so base my rating on that) 
Ease to Pickup with Tutorials: 6/10 (operating some of the vehicles, it isn’t really clear on what to do) 
Depth: 8/10 (the different modes totally make this game the treat it is)
Replayability: 7/10
Overall: 73/100

39369648.review:
Just to vouch, Operation Warcade is... interesting.

The reason it has almost universally positive reviews is because it's the kind of game that you have to be black hearted to give a thumbs down. It's very clearly a labor of love.

I mean, there are a lot of moments of fun to be had, but it's one very well done (and very deep) "step into the old arcade game experience", and it's clearly a focused independent project rather than trying for some kind of mass appeal experience. It knows its target.

Just know that it's a weird ass hybrid faux VR step-into-a-lightgun-arcade-cabinet thing, not a modern video game, and it knows it. It's a very specific labor of love, and it's got some janky parts.

You will either love it or, more likely, recognize it as a passion project and be unable to hate it.

Not sure what my end goal is, because I still say it's a title everyone should try, just know its limitations.

39239602.review: Las recreativas de los 90 en el siglo XXI. Impresionante.

39180931.review:
Operation Warcade is everything you would expect of a VR arcade shooter.

The visuals are near perfect for the style of game they're going for. A lot of the stuff looks just detailed enough to make you forget it's supposed to be an arcade game. Even the arcade room looks semi-decent, though the room's exterior is non-existent and some random Matrix agents are blocking all exits. There should be more people in the arcade, and I'd like to see a child or two running around, trying to earn tickets or something. The immersion of the arcade room may be a little disappointing, but thankfully, it's not a big part of the game experience and can be ignored.

There's very little in the game that would cause motion sickness, though there are some moments where you might get a little queezy. One moment I can think of is when you eject from the plane or possibly right before that, when you're flying. Most of the game keeps you behind an arcade machine screen, though, which helps a lot with the side-scrolling nature of the game.

The gameplay starts a little dull, maybe too easy, but the difficulty level ramps up greatly once you get through the first couple levels and discover you can't get a specific achievement to unlock a star to afford the next level. Then, you have to replay the level many times to try and get that last star.

The audio is a little loud sometimes, but the music can be muted, and the game's sound design really isn't all that bad.

It's a one-of-a-kind experience right now. I recommend getting it on sale, but even at full price, it's priced fair. Get it if you want a game in the arcade shooter genre for VR.

39134546.review:
Meh.

If you have a fondness for the janky nature of most early VR software, you'll probably get a kick out of this. 

Everyone else should wait for a sale. I got it for seven bucks, and I wouldn't have paid more. The mechanics of the game are really neat, but there's some strange design choices and a general absence of polish.

38952210.review:
So, one of the best "wave shooters" and it tries to keep it interesting. After 4 missions, you do feel like you have gotten the gist of everything it has to show, and it would REALLY help to add some boss battles to look forward to at the end of each stage. 

I played with the Zapper attachment, and it worked very well. No real complaints.. cept some of the levels aren't designed for it, so you are better off not using it. 

Yeah.. so I guess, I am glad I bought it, but I am not sure how much playtime I'll get out of it.
